chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall P : Z -> Set, (forall n : Z, (forall m : Z, lt_absZ m n -> P m) -> P n) -> forall p : Z, P p

Premises:
lt_absZ = fun x y : Z => ltZ (absZ x) (absZ y) : Z -> Z -> Prop
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
Zrec4 : forall P : Z -> Set, (forall n : Z, (forall m : Z, lt_absZ m n -> P m) -> P n) -> forall p : nat, and_recZ p P
Zrec1 : forall P : Z -> Set, (forall n : Z, (forall m : Z, lt_absZ m n -> P m) -> P n) -> P OZ
Zrec2 : forall P : Z -> Set, (forall n : Z, (forall m : Z, lt_absZ m n -> P m) -> P n) -> and_recZ 0 P
Zrec3 : forall (P : Z -> Set) (p : nat), (forall n : Z, (forall m : Z, lt_absZ m n -> P m) -> P n) -> and_recZ p P -> and_recZ (S p) P
Z_rec : forall P : Z -> Set, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_ind : forall P : Z -> Prop, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_sind : forall P : Z -> SProp, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_rect : forall P : Z -> Type, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
nat_rec : forall P : nat -> Set, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
sumbool_rec : forall (A B : Prop) (P : {A} + {B} -> Set), (forall a : A, P (left a)) -> (forall b : B, P (right b)) -> forall s : {A} + {B}, P s
ssrbool.prop_in1 : forall T1 : Type, ssrbool.mem_pred T1 -> forall P : T1 -> Prop, ssreflect.phantom Prop (forall x : T1, P x) -> Prop
and_set_set_set_rec : forall (S1 S2 : Set) (P : and_set_set_set S1 S2 -> Set), (forall (s : S2) (s0 : S1), P (and_set_set_set_i S1 S2 s s0)) -> forall a : and_set_set_set S1 S2, P a
ssrbool.prop_on1 : forall T1 T2 T3 : Type, ssrbool.mem_pred T2 -> forall (f : T1 -> T2) (Pf : (T1 -> T2) -> T3) (P : T1 -> Prop), ssreflect.phantom T3 (Pf f) -> ssreflect.phantom Prop (forall x : T1, P x) -> Prop
plus_le_compat_r : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> n + p <= m + p
tech_lt_abs_OZ : forall x : Z, lt_absZ x (pos 0) -> x = OZ
BinInt.Z.bits_inj' : forall a b : BinNums.Z, (forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 n -> BinInt.Z.testbit a n = BinInt.Z.testbit b n) -> a = b
BinInt.Z.add_assoc : forall n m p : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.add n (BinInt.Z.add m p) = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.add n m) p
BinInt.Z.add_shuffle0 : forall n m p : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.add n m) p = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.add n p) m
BinInt.Z.mul_assoc : forall n m p : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.mul n (BinInt.Z.mul m p) = BinInt.Z.mul (BinInt.Z.mul n m) p
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
minus_n_Sm : forall n m : nat, m < n -> Init.Nat.pred (n - m) = n - S m
lt_OZ : forall m : Z, ~ ltZ (absZ m) OZ
Nat.le_antisymm : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> m <= n -> n = m
and_recZ = fun (p : nat) (P : Z -> Set) => forall n : nat, n <= p -> and_set_set_set (P (pos n)) (P (neg n)) : nat -> (Z -> Set) -> Set Arguments and_recZ _%nat_scope _%function_scope

```coq
intros P H.
apply Z_rect.
- apply H. intros m Hm. apply Hm.
- intros n Hn. apply H. intros m Hm. apply Hn. intros k Hk. apply Hm. apply lt_absZ_pos. apply Hk.
- intros n Hn. apply H. intros m Hm. apply Hn. intros k Hk. apply Hm. apply lt_absZ_neg. apply Hk.
Qed.
```
